metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5195 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - high.
metadata.Description:
Race condition in mm/gup.c in the Linux kernel 2.x through 4.x before 4.8.3 allows local users to gain privileges by leveraging incorrect handling of a copy-on-write (COW) feature to write to a read-only memory mapping, as exploited in the wild in October 2016, aka "Dirty COW." It was discovered that a race condition existed in the memory manager of the Linux kernel when handling copy-on-write breakage of private read-only memory mappings. A local attacker could use this to gain administrative privileges.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5195` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-100-generic - 3.13.0-100.147
linux-image-3.13.0-100-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-100.147
linux-image-3.13.0-100-lowlatency - 3.13.0-100.147
linux-image-3.13.0-100-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-100.147
linux-image-3.13.0-100-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-100.147
linux-image-3.13.0-100-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-100.147
linux-image-3.13.0-100-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-100.147
linux-image-3.13.0-100-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-100.147
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-100-generic - 3.13.0-100.147
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-3.19.0-73-generic - 3.19.0-73.81~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-73-generic-lpae - 3.19.0-73.81~14.04.1

notes.Note: jdstrand> android kernels (flo, goldfish, grouper, maguro, mako and manta) are not supported on the Ubuntu Touch 14.10 and earlier preview kernels linux-lts-saucy no longer receives official support linux-lts-quantal no longer receives official support

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-100.147').
linux-aws package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1002.2').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-lts-utopic: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-vivid package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.19.0-73.81~14.04.1').
linux-lts-wily: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-45.66~14.04.1').
linux-maguro: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-manta: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-signed package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-100.147').
linux-signed-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-45.66~14.04.1').
